definition: exceptional/outstanding/dreadful/appalling
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]

to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

not simple/rather complicated/remarkable/marvelous

to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
it goes to show that/one can see
out of the ordinary/out of the common run
excellent/superlative
skillful/proficient
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
to admire
difficult to deal with/difficult to endure/ferocious/radical/serious/terrible/violent/tremendous/awesome

surpassing/preeminent/outstanding
